bid_title: North Hero State Park Site Redevelopment Project
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: Contractors are invited to bid on the North Hero State Park Site Redevelopment Project for the Buildings and General Services on behalf of the Agency of Natural Resources – Forests, Parks and Recreation at 3803 Lakeview Drive in North Hero, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to: Redevelopment of the park to convert paved automobile roads to narrower width walking/biking paths using asphalt reclamation to create new gravel surfaces as well as narrowing existing gravel roads. The Entrance Area will also be improved to expand parking, create an accessible route to the start of the walking/biking path, and a new gate. Several structures on the site will be removed including four Toilet Buildings, the Contact Station and Shed at park entrance, and the Pump House at the old wastewater lagoon. The wastewater lagoon area will be restored with liner pulled and grading to eliminate holding capacity. New path edges and expanded greenspace at the Entrance Area will be tilled, topsoiled, seeded and mulched, (or hydroseeded) to meet Stormwater Post Construction Soil Depth and Quality Standards. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security shall be received by email to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov until September 12, 2024 at 4:30 PM. Documents may be obtained from Blueprints Etc, 20 Farrell Street, South Burlington VT 05403, by phone at 802-865-4503, by fax at 802-865-0027 or email to: orders@blueprintsetc.com. Project Manuals and Plans are available for preview at: http://www.blueprintsetc.com in the Public Plan Room. Any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with this project will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. There is a non-refundable fee for each set of documents purchased. Fee to Include one (1) Hard Copy & one (1) Digital CD-ROM Copy: $TBD 1. Please be advised that all notifications, releases, and addendums associated with this RFP will be posted on-line in the plan room where the original solicitation resides unless otherwise determined that a hard copy is necessary. The state will make no attempt to contact contractors with updated information. It is the responsibility of each contractor to periodically check the posting site for any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with the RFP. 2. NOTE: On occasion hard copy addendums may be required due to size or type of media/requirements. If applicable and as determined by the Department of Buildings and General Services, addendums that require hard copy distribution, a copy of such addenda will be mailed or delivered for each set of plans and specifications issued to the bidders, prior to the bid date. However, it is the responsibility of the bidder to be sure they have received all addenda and must so state the number of addenda they have received on the proposal. 3. If Bidders choose to pull information from other third-party sites, Bidders’ do so at their own risk as there is one official source of information for documents as indicated above. There will be a mandatory pre-bid meeting at the site on August 26, 2024 at 10:00 AM. Contractors to follow Route 2 to 3803 Lakeview Road. Contractors to meet at the contact station to North Hero State Park. QUESTION AND ANSWER PERIOD: Any vendor requiring clarification of any section of this RFP or wishing to comment or take exception to any requirements of the RFP must submit specific questions in writing to BGS.OPCVendorDocs@vermont.gov no later than 4:30 PM on September 3, 2024. All questions should include North Hero State Park Site Redevelopment Project in the subject line. Any comments, questions, or exceptions not raised in writing on or before the last day of the question period are waived. At the close of the question period a copy of all questions or comments and the State's responses will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. Every effort will be made to post this information as soon as possible after the question period ends, contingent on the number and complexity of the questions. Bidder’s attention is directed to: 1. General Conditions for Construction Contracts. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all requirements. Please pay close attention due to changes that have been made. 2. Funding Source: This project is being funded, in whole or in part, through the American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds and/or Vermont Capital Construction Act funds. Socioeconomic affirmative steps per 2 C.F.R. § 200.321: Placing qualified small and minority businesses and women’s business enterprises on solicitation lists; 1. Assuring that small and minority businesses and women’s business enterprises are solicited whenever they are potential sources; 2. Dividing total requirements, when economically feasible, into smaller tasks or quantities to permit maximum participation by small and minority businesses, and women’s business enterprises; 3. Establishing delivery schedules, where the requirement permits, which encourage participation by small and minority businesses, and women’s business enterprises; 4. Using the services and assistance, as appropriate, of such organizations as the Small Business Administration and the Minority Business Development Agency of the Department of Commerce; and 5. Requiring the prime/general contractor, if subcontracts are to be let, to take the same affirmative steps as listed in numbers 1 through 5. 3. BYRD ANTI-LOBBYING CERTIFICATION Contractor has provided the certification required by the Byrd Anti-Lobbying Amendment, 31 U.S.C. § 1352 (as amended, and will follow the requirements for certification of each lower tier (subcontract) to disclose any lobbying with non-federal funds that takes place in connection with obtaining any federal award. Such disclosures will be forwarded from tier to tier up to the Contractor who in turn will forward the certification(s) to the federal awarding agency. 4. DOMESTIC PREFERENCE FOR PROCUREMENTS As appropriate, and to the extent consistent with law, the contractor should, to the greatest extent practicable, provide a preference for the purchase, acquisition, or use of goods, products, or materials produced in the United States. This includes, but is not limited to iron, aluminum, steel, cement, and other manufactured products. For purposes of this clause: Produced in the United States means, for iron and steel products, that all manufacturing processes, from the initial melting stage through the application of coatings, occurred in the United States. Manufactured products mean items and construction materials composed in whole or in part of non-ferrous metals such as aluminum; plastics and polymer-based products such as polyvinyl chloride pipe; aggregates such as concrete; glass, including optical fiber; and lumber.” 5. NOTICE TO BIDDERS – PROHIBITION OF RUSSIAN GOODS: The Contractor is hereby notified that, pursuant to Vermont Executive Order No. 02-22, dated March 3, 2022, the purchase of Russian-sourced goods and goods produced by Russian entities (defined as institutions or companies that are headquartered in Russia or have their principal place of business in Russia) is prohibited. The awarded Contractor must fill out and sign the Executive Order 02-22 Vendor Certification as part of the Contract awarding process. This certification is required for all subcontracts for work performed solely for the State of Vermont and subcontracts for work performed in the State of Vermont. 6. BIDDER QUALIFICATION PROCESS DOCUMENT: The Department of Buildings and General Services is requiring that all contractors meet certain minimum qualifications to be eligible to bid on this project. 7. BID SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS: a. CLOSING DATE: Bids must be received by the State by the due date specified on the front page of this RFP. Late bids will not be considered. i. The State may, for cause, issue an addendum to change the date and/or time when bids are due. If a change is made, the State will inform all bidders by posting it on the webpage indicated on the front page of this RFP. ii. There will not be a public bid opening. However, the State will record the name, city and state for any and all bids received by the due date. b. BID DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS: i. ELECTRONIC: Electronic bids will be accepted. ii. E-MAIL BIDS. Emailed bids will be accepted. Bids will be accepted via email submission to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov . Bids must consist of a single email with a single, digitally searchable PDF attachment containing all components of the bid. Multiple emails and/or multiple attachments will not be accepted. There is an attachment size limit of 40 MB. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to compress the PDF file containing its bid, if necessary, in order to meet this size limitation. It is also the Bidder's responsibility to ensure that their own email system can send and receive messages up to this size. iii. FAX BIDS: Faxed bids will not be accepted. iv. PAPER BIDS: Paper format bids will not be accepted. 8. Full Bonding is required for this job. 9. CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTOR EVALUATION FORM: The Department of Buildings and General Services (BGS) may require contractor evaluations on construction projects over $100,000 or at the discretion of the BGS Director. Evaluations will be used to compile the contractor’s performance on BGS projects to provide a history and assessment of the contractor’s performance. 10. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all instructions and requirements of this bid solicitation.

bid_title: Dead Creek WMA Maintenance Building
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Dead Creek Wildlife Management Area Maintenance Building Project for Buildings and General Services on behalf of the Agency of Natural Resources – Fish and Wildlife at 966 Route 17 West in Addison, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to: The Dead Creek Wildlife Management Area (DCWMA) in Addison had an existing 4100 SF equipment maintenance building that was determined structurally unsafe and subsequently removed in 2019. The need is to replace the original building with a smaller, more efficient code compliant structure in order to properly support the maintenance and operations of the wildlife management area. The Project shall consist of a 66’ x 72’ single story wood framed maintenance building. The new facility shall be constructed on a concrete slab with frost walls, with a separate, heated wood shop, mechanic shop and storage area, and heated vehicle bays. Also included in the project are floor drains with a 50-gallon oil and water separator tank, a 36” diameter fiberglass pump station, 1¼” CTS forcemain, a distribution manifold and drain berm, a 3’ I.D. precast concrete catch basin, 4’ I.D. precast concrete water service valve pit, connecting to the existing municipal water service, yard hydrants, finish grading, bituminous concrete paving, turf establishment and all other appurtenances and incidentals to complete the project. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security will be received by the Department of Buildings and General Services, at 133 State Street, Montpelier, Vermont 05633-8000, until April 17, 2024, at 4:30 PM. Documents may be obtained from Blueprints Etc, 20 Farrell Street, South Burlington VT 05403, by phone at 802- 865-4503, by fax at 802-865-0027 or email to: orders@blueprintsetc.com. Manufactured products mean items and construction materials composed in whole or in part of non-ferrous metals such as aluminum; plastics and polymer-based products such as polyvinyl chloride pipe; aggregates such as concrete; glass, including optical fiber; and lumber.” 5. NOTICE TO BIDDERS – PROHIBITION OF RUSSIAN GOODS: The Contractor is hereby notified that, pursuant to Vermont Executive Order No. 02-22, dated March 3, 2022, the purchase of Russian-sourced goods and goods produced by Russian entities (defined as institutions or companies that are headquartered in Russia or have their principal place of business in Russia) is prohibited. The awarded Contractor must fill out and sign the Executive Order 02-22 Vendor Certification as part of the Contract awarding process. This certification is required for all subcontracts for work performed solely for the State of Vermont and subcontracts for work performed in the State of Vermont. 6. BID SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS: a. CLOSING DATE: Bids must be received by the State by the due date specified on the front page of this RFP. Late bids will not be considered. i. The State may, for cause, issue an addendum to change the date and/or time when bids are due. If a change is made, the State will inform all bidders by posting at the webpage indicated on the front page of this RFP. ii. There will not be a public bid opening. However, the State will record the name, city and state for any and all bids received by the due date. b. BID DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS: i. ELECTRONIC: Electronic bids will be accepted. ii. E-MAIL BIDS. Emailed bids will be accepted. Bids will be accepted via email submission to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov . Bids must consist of a single email with a single, digitally searchable PDF attachment containing all components of the bid. Multiple emails and/or multiple attachments will not be accepted. There is an attachment size limit of 40 MB. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to compress the PDF file containing its bid, if necessary, in order to meet this size limitation. iii. FAX BIDS: Faxed bids will not be accepted. iv. PAPER BIDS: Paper format bids will not be accepted. 7. Full Bonding is required for this job. 8. Contractor is required to carry Builder’s Risk Insurance for this project. 9. CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTOR EVALUATION FORM: The Department of Buildings and General Services (BGS) may require contractor evaluations on construction projects over $100,000 or at the discretion of the BGS Director. Evaluations will be used to compile the contractor’s performance on BGS projects to provide a history and assessment of the contractor’s performance. 10. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all instructions and requirements of this bid solicitation.

bid_title: BGS MVRCF REROOF
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: Revision Date: July 20, 2023 Page | 1 INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Marble Valley Regional Correctional Facility (MVRCF) Reroof Project for Buildings and General Services at 167 State Street in Rutland, Vermont. This project consists of but is not limited to removing the existing ballasted roof, insulation and flashing in its entirety, and the installation of a new EPDM roof system, insulation, wall cap coping, and flashings per plans and specifications prepared by Black River Design dated June 2023. The project scope shall include the removal and re-installation of all roof top equipment as needed, curb extensions, light tube replacement, exhaust fan replacement, masonry flashing installation and brick re-pointing. The new roof shall meet current energy standards and will require raised curbing heights in some areas allowing for the increase in insulation. Contractors and sub-contractors must submit and pass the standard Department of Corrections background check prior to the project start date. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security will be received by the Department of Buildings and General Services, at 133 State Street, Montpelier, Vermont 05633-8000, until January 9, 2024 at 4:30 PM. Documents may be obtained from Blueprints, Etc., 20 Farrell Street, South Burlington, VT 05403, by phone at 802.865.4503, by fax at 802.865.0027 or email to: orders@blueprintsetc.com. Project Manuals and Plans are available for preview at: http://www.blueprintsetc.com in the Private Plan Room. Contractors shall obtain password to access this project from Blueprints. Any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with this project will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. There is a non-refundable fee for each set of documents purchased. Fee to Include one (1) Hard Copy & one (1) Digital CD-ROM Copy: $TBD 1. Please be advised that all notifications, releases, and addendums associated with this RFP will be posted on-line in the plan room where the original solicitation resides unless otherwise determined that a hard copy is necessary. The state will make no attempt to contact contractors with updated information. It is the responsibility of each contractor to periodically check the posting site for any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with the RFP. 2. NOTE: On occasion hard copy addendums may be required due to size or type of media/requirements. If applicable and as determined by the Department of Buildings and General Services, addendums that require hard copy distribution, a copy of such addenda will be mailed or delivered for each set of plans and specifications issued to the bidders, prior to the bid date. However, it is the responsibility of the bidder to be sure they have received all addenda, and must so state the number of addenda they have received on the proposal. 3. If Bidders choose to pull information from other third-party sites, Bidders do so at their own risk as there is one official source of information for documents as indicated above. There will be a non-mandatory pre-bid meeting at the site on December 7, 2023 at 9:30 AM. Bidders are to meet at the entry way of MVRCF. Revision Date: July 20, 2023 Page | 2 QUESTION AND ANSWER PERIOD: Any vendor requiring clarification of any section of this RFP or wishing to comment or take exception to any requirements of the RFP must submit specific questions in writing to BGS.OPCVendorDocs@vermont.gov no later than 4:30 PM on December 21, 2023. All questions should include Marble Valley Regional Correctional Facility (MVRCF) Reroof Project in the subject line. Any comments, questions, or exceptions not raised in writing on or before the last day of the question period are waived. At the close of the question period a copy of all questions or comments and the State's responses will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. Every effort will be made to post this information as soon as possible after the question period ends, contingent on the number and complexity of the questions. Bidder’s attention is directed to: 1. General Conditions for Construction Contracts. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all requirements. Please pay close attention due to the changes that have been made. 2. Funding Source: This project is being funded, in whole or in part, through the American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds and/or Vermont Capital Construction Act funds. Wages for construction employees shall be paid no less than the Vermont Prevailing Wage and Fringe Benefit Rate requirements (reference Instructions to Bidders, Prevailing Wage Rate Requirements). A complete list of occupations and associated wage rates are available on the internet at: http://www.vtlmi.info/lmipub.htm If a bidder requires assistance in preparing their proposal, registering with SAM.gov or needs guidance on socioeconomic certifications, the bidder may contact the Agency of Commerce & Community Development (ACCD), Department of Economic Development (DED), APEX Accelerator. The Vermont APEX Accelerator (formerly the Procurement Technical Assistance Center (PTAC)) specializes in helping small businesses navigate the documentation associated with State and Federal procurement. There is no cost to the Contractor for assistance provided by APEX Accelerator. Their website is: https://accd.vermont.gov/economic-development/programs/ptac 3. NOTICE TO BIDDERS – PROHIBITION OF RUSSIAN GOODS: The Contractor is hereby notified that, pursuant to Vermont Executive Order No. 02-22, dated March 3, 2022, the purchase of Russian-sourced goods and goods produced by Russian entities (defined as institutions or companies that are headquartered in Russia or have their principal place of business in Russia) is prohibited. The awarded Contractor must fill out and sign the Executive Order 02-22 Vendor Certification as part of the Contract awarding process. This certification is required for all subcontracts for work performed solely for the State of Vermont and subcontracts for work performed in the State of Vermont. 4. BID SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS: a. CLOSING DATE: Bids must be received by the State by the due date specified on the front page of this RFP. Late bids will not be considered. Revision Date: July 20, 2023 Page | 3 i. The State may, for cause, issue an addendum to change the date and/or time when bids are due. If a change is made, the State will inform all bidders by posting it on the webpage indicated on the front page of this RFP. ii. There will not be a public bid opening. However, the State will record the name, city and state for any and all bids received by the due date. b. STATE SECURITY PROCEDURES: Please be advised extra time will be needed when visiting and/or delivering information to State of Vermont offices. All individuals visiting State offices must present a valid government issued photo ID when entering the facility. i. State office buildings may be locked or otherwise closed to the public. If this RFP permits hand delivery of bids, delivery instructions will be posted at the entrance to the State facility. Any delay caused by State Security Procedures will be at the bidder’s own risk. c. BID DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS: i. ELECTRONIC: Electronic bids will be accepted. ii. E-MAIL BIDS. Emailed bids will be accepted. Bids will be accepted via email submission to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov. Bids must consist of a single email with a single, digitally searchable PDF attachment containing all components of the bid. Multiple emails and/or multiple attachments will not be accepted. There is an attachment size limit of 40 MB. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to compress the PDF file containing its bid if necessary in order to meet this size limitation. iii. FAX BIDS: Faxed bids will not be accepted. iv. PAPER BIDS: Paper format bids will not be accepted. 5. Full Bonding is required for this job. 6. SUBMITTAL EXCHANGE®: Contractor shall obtain a license for the State to utilize Submittal Exchange for the purposes of this project. The State and its representatives will have full control of the use of Submittal Exchange by authorized users of the State. Submittal Exchange®, a web-based collaboration software system, shall be used to provide an on-line database and repository, which shall be used to transmit and track project-related documents. Based on an existing contract between the State and Submittal Exchange, the State anticipates that training and support during this project will be provided by Submittal Exchange at no additional cost to the selected contractor(s). 7. CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTOR EVALUATION FORM: The Department of Buildings and General Services (BGS) may require contractor evaluations on construction projects over $100,000 or at the discretion of the BGS Director. Evaluations will be used to compile the contractor’s performance on BGS projects to provide a history and assessment of the contractor’s performance. Revision Date: July 20, 2023 Page | 4 8. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all instructions and requirements of this bid solicitation. Sincerely Jennifer Fitch, Commissioner

bid_title: Woodford State Park Water Utility Improvements RFP
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Woodford State Park Water Distribution Utility Improvements Project for Buildings and General Services on behalf of the Agency of Natural Resources – Forests, Parks and Recreation at 142 State Park Road in Woodford, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to replace all system galvanized water mains and services with HDPE pipe/tubing, sized to minimize friction loss and create system looping for enhanced system hydraulics and improved operability. Main line loop in tie in points will be with valve vaults, with individual services installed with curb stops. The project also involves upgrades to the system pump house to provide additional or new system components, abandon/remove old service feed lines and simplify plumbing. Improvements will also include new waterline service to new ADA compliant water stands within all camping loops and complete water pressure tank replacement within the Ranger’s residence at reception area. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security will be received by email to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov, until June 12, 2024 at 4:30 PM. Documents may be obtained from Blueprints Etc, 20 Farrell Street, South Burlington VT 05403, by phone at 802-865-4503, by fax at 802-865-0027 or email to: orders@blueprintsetc.com. Project Manuals and Plans are available for preview at: http://www.blueprintsetc.com in the Public Plan Room. Any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with this project will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. There is a non-refundable fee for each set of documents purchased. However, it is the responsibility of the bidder to be sure they have received all addenda, and must so state the number of addenda they have received on the proposal. 3. If Bidders choose to pull information from other third-party sites, Bidders do so at their own risk as there is one official source of information for documents as indicated above. There will be a non-mandatory pre-bid meeting at the site on May 22, 2024 at 11:00 AM. Bidders are to meet at Park Reception Area just after entrance to Park. QUESTION AND ANSWER PERIOD: Any vendor requiring clarification of any section of this RFP or wishing to comment or take exception to any requirements of the RFP must submit specific questions in writing to BGS.OPCVendorDocs@vermont.gov no later than 4:30 PM on May 31, 2024. All questions should include Woodford State Park Water Distribution Utility Improvements Project in the subject line. Any comments, questions, or exceptions not raised in writing on or before the last day of the question period are waived. At the close of the question period a copy of all questions or comments and the State's responses will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. Every effort will be made to post this information as soon as possible after the question period ends, contingent on the number and complexity of the questions. Bidder’s attention is directed to: 1. Please pay close attention due to the changes that have been made. 2. Funding Source: This project is being funded, in whole or in part, through the American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds and/or Vermont Capital Construction Act funds. 3. NOTICE TO BIDDERS – PROHIBITION OF RUSSIAN GOODS: The Contractor is hereby notified that, pursuant to Vermont Executive Order No. 02-22, dated March 3, 2022, the purchase of Russian-sourced goods and goods produced by Russian entities (defined as institutions or companies that are headquartered in Russia or have their principal place of business in Russia) is prohibited. The awarded Contractor must fill out and sign the Executive Order 02-22 Vendor Certification as part of the Contract awarding process. This certification is required for all subcontracts for work performed solely for the State of Vermont and subcontracts for work performed in the State of Vermont. 4. BID SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS: a. CLOSING DATE: Bids must be received by the State by the due date specified on the front page of this RFP. Late bids will not be considered. i. However, the State will record the name, city and state for any and all bids received by the due date. b. BID DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS: i. ELECTRONIC: Electronic bids will be accepted. ii. E-MAIL BIDS. bid_title: ANR Green River Reservoir State Park ADA Boardwalk Renovation RFP
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: STATE OF VERMONT AGENCY OF NATURAL RESOURCES DEPARTMENT OF FORESTS, PARKS & RECREATION REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS Green River Reservoir State Park Boardwalk ADA Renovation Project Hyde Park, Vermont INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Green River Reservoir State Park ADA Boardwalk Renovation for Buildings and General Services on behalf of the Agency of Natural Resources – Forests, Parks and Recreation at 1394 Green River Dam Road in Hyde Park, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to site work, the installation of Helio Pile Footings, framing, decking and resurfacing of trail tread and finish grading within a designated wetland for a Universal Accessible Car Top Boat Launch Boardwalk/Trail approximately 5' wide x 400 Lineal Feet in length. Detailed scope is included in the plans and specifications prepared by Cushman Design Group. Bidder to complete the Bidder Qualification Process forms and submit with their Bid Proposal. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security will be received by email to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov, until June 7, 2024 at 4:30 PM. Documents may be obtained from Blueprints Etc, 20 Farrell Street, South Burlington VT 05403, by phone at 802-865-4503, by fax at 802-865-0027 or email to: orders@blueprintsetc.com. Project Manuals and Plans are available for preview at: http://www.blueprintsetc.com in the Public Plan Room. Any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with this project will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. There is a non-refundable fee for each set of documents purchased. Fee to Include one (1) Hard Copy & one (1) Digital CD-ROM Copy: $TBD 1. Please be advised that all notifications, releases, and addendums associated with this RFP will be posted on-line in the plan room where the original solicitation resides unless otherwise determined that a hard copy is necessary. The state will make no attempt to contact contractors with updated information. It is the responsibility of each contractor to periodically check the posting site for any and all notifications, releases and addendums associated with the RFP. 2. NOTE: On occasion hard copy addendums may be required due to size or type of media/requirements. If applicable and as determined by the Department of Buildings and General Services, addendums that require hard copy distribution, a copy of such addenda will be mailed or delivered for each set of plans and specifications issued to the bidders, prior to the bid date. However, it is the responsibility of the bidder to be sure they have received all addenda, and must so state the number of addenda they have received on the proposal. 3. If Bidders choose to pull information from other third-party sites, Bidders do so at their own risk as there is one official source of information for documents as indicated above. There will be a non-mandatory pre-bid meeting at the site on May 17, 2024 at 9:00 AM. QUESTION AND ANSWER PERIOD: Any vendor requiring clarification of any section of this RFP or wishing to comment or take exception to any requirements of the RFP must submit specific questions in writing to BGS.OPCVendorDocs@vermont.gov no later than 4:30 PM on May 24, 2024. All questions should include Green River Reservoir State Park ADA Boardwalk Renovation Project in the subject line. Any comments, questions, or exceptions not raised in writing on or before the last day of the question period are waived. At the close of the question period a copy of all questions or comments and the State's responses will be posted at http://www.blueprintsetc.com. Every effort will be made to post this information as soon as possible after the question period ends, contingent on the number and complexity of the questions. Bidder’s attention is directed to: 1. General Conditions for Construction Contracts. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all requirements. Please pay close attention due to the changes that have been made. 2. Funding Source: This project is being funded, in whole or in part, through the American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) funds and/or Vermont Capital Construction Act funds. 3. NOTICE TO BIDDERS – PROHIBITION OF RUSSIAN GOODS: The Contractor is hereby notified that, pursuant to Vermont Executive Order No. 02-22, dated March 3, 2022, the purchase of Russian-sourced goods and goods produced by Russian entities (defined as institutions or companies that are headquartered in Russia or have their principal place of business in Russia) is prohibited. The awarded Contractor must fill out and sign the Executive Order 02-22 Vendor Certification as part of the Contract awarding process. This certification is required for all subcontracts for work performed solely for the State of Vermont and subcontracts for work performed in the State of Vermont. 4. BIDDER QUALIFICATION PROCESS DOCUMENT: The Department of Buildings and General Services requires that all contractors meet certain minimum qualifications to be eligible to bid on this project. 5. BID SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS: a. CLOSING DATE: Bids must be received by the State by the due date specified on the front page of this RFP. Late bids will not be considered. i. The State may, for cause, issue an addendum to change the date and/or time when bids are due. If a change is made, the State will inform all bidders by posting it on the webpage indicated on the front page of this RFP. ii. There will not be a public bid opening. However, the State will record the name, city and state for any and all bids received by the due date. b. BID DELIVERY INSTRUCTIONS: i. ELECTRONIC: Electronic bids will be accepted. ii. E-MAIL BIDS. Emailed bids will be accepted. Bids will be accepted via email submission to BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov . Bids must consist of a single email with a single, digitally searchable PDF attachment containing all components of the bid. Multiple emails and/or multiple attachments will not be accepted. There is an attachment size limit of 40 MB. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to compress the PDF file containing its bid if necessary, in order to meet this size limitation. iii. FAX BIDS: Faxed bids will not be accepted. iv. PAPER BIDS: Paper format bids will not be accepted. 6. Full Bonding is required for this job. 7. SUBMITTAL EXCHANGE®: Contractor shall obtain a license for the State to utilize Submittal Exchange for the purposes of this project. The State and its representatives will have full control of the use of Submittal Exchange by authorized users of the State. Submittal Exchange®, a web-based collaboration software system, shall be used to provide an on-line database and repository, which shall be used to transmit and track project-related documents. Based on an existing contract between the State and Submittal Exchange, the State anticipates that training and support during this project will be provided by Submittal Exchange at no additional cost to the selected contractor(s). 8. CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTOR EVALUATION FORM: The Department of Buildings and General Services (BGS) may require contractor evaluations on construction projects over $100,000 or at the discretion of the BGS Director. Evaluations will be used to compile the contractor’s performance on BGS projects to provide a history and assessment of the contractor’s performance. 9. It is the Bidder’s responsibility to thoroughly read and comply with all instructions and requirements of this bid solicitation.

bid_title: Chittenden Regional Correctional Facility (CRCF) Attic Catwalk RFP
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Chittenden Regional Correctional Facility (CRCF) Attic Catwalk Project for Buildings and General Services at 7 Farrell Street in South Burlington, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to: Create a maintenance catwalk to allow for safe access to the space for routine maintenance and future improvements at Chittenden Regional Correctional Facility. The Work is within an above-ceiling interstitial space over secured space below. The Work is to be executed from the roof. Access to the space will be through the newly created opening as part of this work. Secured facility requirements will remain in place at all times. To the extent practical, work is to be executed offsite with on-site activities limited to installation and assembly. While the project is under construction the facility will remain in operation. Close coordination with the occupant will be required at all times as not to impact the operation of the facility. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security shall be emailed to the Department of Buildings and General Services, at BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov, until December 5, 2024, at 4:30 PM. bid_title: Springfield State Office Building Flooring and Ceiling Replacement
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Springfield State Office Building Flooring + Ceiling Replacement - Phase 2 (Second Floor) Project for the Department of Buildings and General Services at 100 Mineral Street in Springfield, Vermont. This project consists of Phase II Renovations’ scope that will address only the second-floor level of the facility. The work shall include, but not be limited to the following: 1. Demolition of existing vinyl floor tile and wall base. 2. Remove ceiling paint to underside of the deck. 3. Remove acoustical ceiling tile, and grid. 4. Remove ceramic tile to public restrooms. 5. Remove existing carpet tile. 6. Provide and install resilient tile as illustrated in drawing scope. 7. Provide and install new acoustical ceiling tile and grid. Sealed Bids accompanied by proper Bid Security shall be emailed to the Department of Buildings and General Services, at BGS.VTBids@vermont.gov, until August 30, 2024, at 4:30 PM. bid_title: ANR DEC Lake Carmi Mill Pond Dam Improvements
department: Buildings & General Svs, Office of Purchasing & Contracting
bid_description: INVITATION TO BID DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND GENERAL SERVICES STATE OF VERMONT Contractors are invited to bid on the Lake Carmi/Mill Pond Dam Improvements for the Agency of Natural Resources – Department of Environmental Conservation located at 3595 Vermont Route 120 in Franklin, Vermont. This project consists of, but is not limited to: Repairs to Lake Carmi / Mill Pond Dam located in Franklin, VT. This project will includes leveling the embankment crest, installing over-topping protection, clearing and grubbing, installing a chain-link fence, improving the parking lot, minor concrete repairs, removal of the inoperable Low-Level Outlet (LLO) at right abutment, new LLO at left abutment, removal of stop logs and replacement with fixed concrete crest. Left abutment will involve temporary cofferdam and work in the water and will take place before regulatory out of water date. Right abutment work will not involve temporary coffer dam work is to be performed in the dry. Right abutment work will take place after October, 1st per agreement with adjacent campground property owner. Site access at the left abutment will involve only State property, while construction at the right abutment involves a temporary construction easement across campground property. bid_title: Canaan Schools Food Service
bid_description: Canaan School District is seeking bids for food service management for the 2023-2024 school year.

bid_title: Pellet Boiler Conversion for North Country Supervisory Union
bid_description: The North Country Supervisory Union Board invites interested Contractors to submit a Request for proposal for their upcoming pellet boiler replacement project. Project Description: Provide and install (3) MESys PE(S)56* 191 MBH Pellet Boilers (Or equal) to replace the existing (2) oil fired boilers. Total Btu/hr to be ~600 MBH. The project start date is June 2024 to be completed by August 2024.This project is being funded by federal American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA) State Fiscal Recovery (SFR) funds which will require contractors to follow Davis Bacon requirements.

bid_title: RFP - PlanBTV New North End
bid_description: The Chittenden County Regional Planning Commission (CCRPC), in partnership with the City of Burlington, invites qualified firms, or a team of firms, to submit written proposals for the development of a comprehensive planBTV: New North End (NNE) project. The objective of this project is to establish a long-term vision for Burlington’s New North End neighborhoods, guiding future growth and infrastructure investments to create a vibrant, welcoming, accessible, and sustainable collection of distinct districts and neighborhoods. Key tasks for the consultant(s) will include: • Analyzing and integrating an existing conditions analysis and input gleaned from public visioning workshops into the plan. • Developing a comprehensive plan that integrates land use, transportation, housing, and infrastructure strategies. • Identifying infill development opportunities and creating detailed urban design frameworks for focus areas. • Planning for multi-modal transportation and enhancing the North Avenue corridor and Burlington Greenway. • Assessing regulatory barriers and conducting an equity impact assessment. • Delivering a final plan with actionable strategies, an implementation matrix, and recommendations for necessary ordinance amendments.

bid_title: Huntington Town Plan Update
bid_description: The Town of Huntington recently received a Municipal Planning Grant (MPG) from the Vermont Agency of Commerce and Community Development (ACCD) to update the Vision, Goals, and Land Use Map in the Huntington Town Plan.

bid_title: Town of St. George – VCDP Planning Grant RFP: Architectural and Electrical Engineering Planning
bid_description: The Town of St. George is seeking proposals from qualified consultants for architectural and engineering services to support ADA compliance improvements and solar and battery backup planning for the Town Office and Little Red Schoolhouse. The project is funded through a Vermont Community Development Program Planning Grant and the Municipal Technical Assistance Program and aims to enhance accessibility and emergency resilience. Minority, women, veteran, and small businesses are encouraged to apply. Key Dates: · RFP Release: January 3, 2025 · Site Visit: January 14, 2025, at 10:00 AM · Questions Deadline: January 17, 2025 · Proposal Submission Deadline: January 31, 2025, at 4:00 PM Submission Details: Proposals must be submitted via email to Sarah Muskin, CCRPC Planner, at smuskin@ccrpcvt.org by 4:00 PM on January 31, 2025. Late submissions will not be accepted. The full RFP, including detailed scope of work, evaluation criteria, and submission requirements, is available on the Town of St. George’s website. For questions, contact Sarah Muskin at smuskin@ccrpcvt.org.

bid_title: Design Services for Waterline Extension on Redmond Road in Williston VT
bid_description: The Chittenden Solid Waste District (the District, CSWD), is requesting Design Services for Waterline Extension on Redmond Road in Williston Vermont. CSWD is requesting Proposals from qualified Consultants, Engineers, and/or Architects to provide professional design, engineering, technical specifications and construction drawings, complete permitting support, and pre-construction cost estimates, as well as resident engineering services during construction.

bid_title: RFP No. 20250106 Marketing and Advertising Services
bid_description: CSWD seeks qualified agencies to provide marketing and advertising services to the District as its Agency of Record. The services shall include but not be limited to: creative services, media buying and planning, advertising campaign management and execution, marketing strategic development, and graphic design.

bid_title: Bartlett Bay WWTF Biological Process and SCADA Upgrade with Real-Time Cloud-Based Process Optimization System, South Bur
bid_description: Owner is seeking bids for the Bartlett Bay Wastewater Treatment Facility Biological Process and SCADA Upgrade with Digital Performance Platform for inclusion as an allowance in a general construction contract. Manufacturer as “Seller” shall be required to furnish equipment as specified here-in to the awardee of the general contract (“Buyer”) at the bid price submitted.

bid_title: Burlington’s Construction and Weatherization Workforce Training Program
department: City of Burlington - Business and Workforce Development
bid_description: The City of Burlington is requesting proposals from workforce training organizations for training services related to workforce development. The purpose of the workforce development portion of the project is to provide construction-related and weatherization training to individuals in the Burlington area. This is part of Burlington’s Great Streets Project funded in-part by the Rebuilding American Infrastructure with Sustainability and Equity grant awarded to the City in the spring of 2023.

bid_title: Rebranding Initiative
bid_description: The City of Essex Junction is seeking a qualified graphic designer, design firm, or agency to develop a long-standing, clearly recognizable brand identity and brand style guide. The project will include visual elements, messaging, and guidance on incorporating sub-brands for departments. One objective of the project is to create a logo that has a wide appeal and reflects the community as a whole. The chosen designer or firm will also provide a style guide for graphics, templates to meet the necessities of day-to-day operations (e.g., letterheads, memos, report covers, and city apparel), signage, and banners. Proposals are to be submitted by 4:00 PM (local time) on May 5, 2025, at the City Office, 2 Lincoln Street, Essex Junction, Vermont, 05452. Proposals shall be marked to the attention of Ashley Snellenberger, Communications and Strategic Initiatives Director. Digital proposals may be submitted via email to asnellenberger@essexjunction.org, but the City assumes no responsibility for formatting or transmission errors. The complete RFP may be obtained, without charge, on the City of Essex Junction webpage at www.essexjunction.org/news/invitation-to-bid, at the City Office, or by calling (802) 878-6944. Please direct all questions regarding this request for proposals by April 28, 2025, to Ashley Snellenberger, Communications and Strategic Initiatives Director, at asnellenberger@essexjunction.org or 802-878-6944 EXT 1601. All answers to questions received will be posted to the City’s website by April 29, 2025. The City of Essex Junction, through its Authorized Representative, reserves the right to waive any informalities in or reject any and all proposals, in whole or in part, or to accept any proposal deemed to be in the best interest of the City of Essex Junction.

bid_title: Meal Service Vendor - Municipal Equipment Show
bid_description: The New England Chapter of America Public Works Association (NEAPWA) is seeking proposals from qualified vendors to provide meal services during the 2025 Municipal Equipment Show. This event will be held on May 7th, 2025 at the Barre Auditorium, and will host a variety of attendees including industry professionals, exhibitors, and municipal representatives. We are looking for an experienced meal service vendor to offer quality, timely, and diverse food options to attendees during the show

bid_title: Economic Development Strategic Plan for the City of South Burlington, VT
bid_description: The City of South Burlington, Vermont (the “City”) is seeking proposals from forward thinking firms with demonstrated experience in providing data collection and stakeholder engagement resulting in an economic development strategic plan. Award and signature of contract will be in December 2024. Procurement for selection of the consultant will be a one step process with up to four finalists selected for interviews. The successful Consultant will be selected based upon their demonstrated ability to achieve the goals of the project through their qualifications, proposal, and interview with the selection committee. The resulting strategic plan will be action oriented to grow a diverse and vibrant economy. The plan will provide the City with a roadmap to a future embraced by the community and which resonates within the region. The City of South Burlington is located in the Lake Champlain Valley between the Green Mountains and the Adirondacks. The City has enjoyed a steady growth rate for decades, with a population of just over 20,000 residents in 2020. The fastest growing demographic is BIPOC. The City hosts just under 18,000 jobs (2021). With proximity to Burlington, Vermont’s largest city, UVM Medical Center and the University of Vermont (UVM), and GlobalFoundries Fab 9, and containing transportation advantages (airport, interstate, broadband superhighway) South Burlington has retained established Vermont brands such as Ben & Jerry’s and attracted new companies such as Beta Technologies and OnLogic. South Burlington features several retail corridors (including the State’s largest mall) and a concentration of hotels. The City is invested in supporting a new walkable bikeable downtown and our Climate Action Plan.

bid_title: Fonda Public Improvements Project
bid_description: Update: Bid deadline has been extended to March 20, 2024 at 3:00 PM. Bid questions and addenda have been posted to www.stalbansvt.com/rfps. Sealed Bids for the construction of site work for the Fonda Public Improvements Project will be received by the City of St. Albans at the office of the Engineer, Cross Consulting Engineers, 103 Fairfax Road, St. Albans, VT 05478, until 3:00 P.M. local time, March 20, 2024. The Bids received will be opened publicly at 3pm on March 20, 2024 at Cross Consulting Engineers office. Bidders are not required to be present at bid opening. Cross Consulting Engineers has been asked by the owner to review all bids vs the engineer’s estimate. This project consists of the construction of a new city street and sidewalk along with the installation and replacement of underground utilities. Completion date is October 30, 2024. Bids will be received for a single prime Contract. Bids shall be on a lump sum basis, with alternate bid items as indicated in the Bid Form. All bidders must provide their UEI number with their bids. The Issuing Office for the Bidding Documents is: Cross Consulting Engineers, PC. Bidders may examine the Bidding Documents at the Issuing Office on Mondays through Fridays during regular business hours and may obtain copies of the Bidding Documents from the Issuing Office at cost. The bidder MUST review the bid opportunity and all documents linked at https://www.stalbansvt.com/rfps This webpage is where all pertinent documents and updates will be linked. No prebid conference will be held. All questions shall be referred to the Engineer at pgarceau@crossconsultingengineers.com. Deadline for questions is end of day Thursday, March 7, 2024. Bidders may inspect the work at any time.

bid_title: RFP for Historic Survey of French-Canadian Heritage District
bid_description: The purpose of this project is to survey an area of the City that is associated with a particular ethnic heritage and history. The final product of the project will be a survey report with recommendations for property eligibility and for preparation of a nomination to National Register as a possible second phase of this effort. The RFP and all addenda are posted at www.stalbansvt.com/rfps. Please check that page regularly.

bid_title: RFP for Local Hazard Mitigation Plan
bid_description: The City of St. Albans (the City) seeks a qualified contractor to engage in a public process to update the City’s local hazard mitigation plan (LHMP) in a manner compliant with the standards of the Vermont Dept. of Public Safety and the U.S. Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). REQUIRED: Read the full RFP document at www.stalbansvt.com/rfps.

bid_title: Request for Proposals for Website Consulting and Services
bid_description: The City is seeking a professional consultant concerning the Downtown St. Albans website. Review the RFP and any supplementary information at https://www.stalbansvt.com/rfps.

bid_title: Federal Street Remediation
bid_description: Construction of parking lot with remediation of contaminated soils.

bid_title: Rectangular Rapid Flash Beacon Replacement Bid
bid_description: The City of Winooski is requesting bids from qualified contractors to furnish and install four (4) single-sided Rectangular Rapid Flashing Beacons (RRFBs) to replace existing damaged RRFBs, as shown in the location below. The work includes the removal of two (2) existing beacon poles, the installation of new poles with beacons, the reuse of existing footings, and the replacement of two (2) anchor bolt assemblies. The contractor shall supply all labor and materials required for a complete installation. The contractor will be responsible for any required traffic control.

bid_title: Cab-Chassis Truck with Dump Body
bid_description: The City of Winooski, Vermont, requests sealed bids for furnishing a new regular cab class 5 (F550, 5500, etc..) 4x4 truck chassis with a 2–3-yard dump body. The truck will be equipped with a V8 gasoline engine.

bid_title: Information Technology Managed Services Provider
bid_description: The City of Winooski (the City) invites qualified professional vendors for Information Technology Support services. The qualified vendor will enable the City to maintain and continue to improve information technology (IT) effectiveness, enhance quality of services, minimize support costs, and maximize return on investment. At a minimum, services associated with this request include desktop applications support, server administration services, network administration, cybersecurity, and strategic planning of system maintenance and enhancements. All proposals must conform to the specifications outlined in the attached bid document.

bid_title: Abenaki Food Shelf
bid_description: Maquam Bay of Missisquoi, a tax-exempt nonprofit, is requesting proposals for a Construction Manager as constructor for the renovation of the Abenaki Nation of Missisquoi's tribal headquarters and food pantry. The building is a contributing member to the Village of Swanton's historic district and requires rehabilitation to the shell, roof, entryway, interior HVAC and electrical systems, refrigeration, and finishes. Full drawings and specifications are available at Blueprints, Etc.

bid_title: PFAS Treatment Efficacy Study
department: DEC - DRINKING WATER & GROUNDWATER PROTECTION DIVISION
bid_description: The DEC Drinking Water and Groundwater Protection Division (DWGPD)is seeking proposals from laboratories certified by the Vermont Department of Health to perform Laboratory Analytical Services for the PFAS Treatment Efficacy Study. DWGPD will coordinate with each of the four water systems to collect drinking water samples and will be responsible for coordinating with the laboratories to ensure samples arrive and are analyzed within the method hold time. The laboratory will analyze drinking water samples for water quality parameters and for PFAS compounds as described in more detail in the RFP.

bid_title: Fiscal Year 2025 Solid Waste Implementation Program (SWIP)
bid_description: 10 V.S.A. § 6603c and 10 V.S.A. § 6618 requires that a portion of the Solid Waste Management Assistance Fund be used for municipalities to meet requirements for proper management and diversion of household hazardous waste and landfill banned materials as outlined in their Solid Waste Implementation Plans. Each year, the State awards approximately $614,000 to support municipalities through Participant Support Cost Awards. The awards are based on a set formula explained in the “Funding Allocation” section of this RFA. DEC is seeking applications for the Fiscal Year 2025 Solid Waste Implementation Program (SWIP).

bid_description: 10 V.S.A. § 6603c and 10 V.S.A. § 6618 requires that a portion of the Solid Waste Management Assistance Fund be used for municipalities to meet requirements for proper management and diversion of household hazardous waste and landfill banned materials as outlined in their Solid Waste Implementation Plans. Each year, the State awards approximately $614,000 to support municipalities through Participant Support Cost Awards. The awards are based on a set formula explained in the “Funding Allocation” section of this RFA. DEC is seeking applications for the Fiscal Year 2025 Solid Waste Implementation Program (SWIP).

bid_title: Recycling System Analysis Study 2024
bid_description: The State seeks proposals for an updated “Recycling Systems Analysis” study evaluating the costs and benefits of various models for the management of beverage containers, including under the existing Bottle Bill and recycling system and under an Expanded Bottle Bill (“EBB”) system. This study must also explore the costs and benefits of an Expanded Bottle Bill under a modernized “extended producer responsibility” (EPR) program model as proposed by H.158 of 2023

bid_title: 2024 Noyes Pond Dam Rehabilitation Project Design, Permitting, and Construction Phase Services
bid_description: The Vermont Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC), in coordination with the Vermont Dam Safety Program (DSP), is seeking technical and fee proposals from qualified dam engineering consultants experienced with dam inspection, survey, wetland/waters delineation, historic/archeological assessment, hydraulic design, geotechnical design, structural design, permitting, cost estimation, bid phase services, and construction management/observation regarding the Noyes Pond Dam in Groton, Vermont. All of these experiential factors and skills will bef integral to the preparation of a final design for repairing serious structural deficiencies currently present in the Dam.

bid_title: Handpull Water Chestnut with Motorized Boats
bid_description: 2024 Water Chestnut Management Program focuses on the removal of water chestnut (Trapa natans) by hand from locations in and around southern Lake Champlain in tandem with State staff at sites that have historic large populations of water chestnut that are managed through mechanical harvesting operations. The contractor will work with the State to identify, access, and harvest locations that are inaccessible to the mechanical harvesting operations.

bid_title: Enhanced Agricultural Riparian Buffer Pilot Projects
bid_description: The State of Vermont announces the release of a request for proposals to fund a Funding Program Administrator (FPA) to manage a competitive project solicitation process for installation and/or maintenance of new and prior tree planting sites, and to support the capacity of partners through trainings.
awardee_name: Franklin County Natural Resources Conservation District

bid_title: 2025 Enhancement Riparian Buffer Planting Initiative
bid_description: The Department of Environmental Conservation Clean Water Initiative Program is requesting proposals to manage a competitive Enhancement Riparian Buffer Planting Initiative. The intent of the program is to support the implementation of eligible, priority enhancement riparian buffer planting projects.

bid_title: 2025 Enhancement Riparian Buffer Planting Initiative
bid_description: The Department of Environmental Conservation Clean Water Initiative Program is requesting proposals to manage a competitive Enhancement Riparian Buffer Planting Initiative. The intent of the program is to support the implementation of eligible, priority enhancement riparian buffer planting projects.

bid_title: Implementing Methods to Map, Inventory, and Prioritize Non-Municipal Road Improvements in Vermont
bid_description: The State is requesting proposals for a single entity to administer and develop a Private Roads Erosion Inventory (REI) Program to provide technical assistance, support capacity building, and oversee the completion of an estimated 12-20 REIs on private roads (defined here as private roads present in State data and/or the E911 driveway data layers) throughout all of Vermont's sub-basins of Lake Champlain.

bid_title: 3-ACRE MANUFACTURED HOUSING COMMUNITIES STORMWATER CONSTRUCTION AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
bid_description: The purpose is to provide funding and technical and administrative assistance on behalf of “three-acre" Manufactured Housing Communities (MHCs) in the Lake Champlain and Lake Memphremagog basins to ensure as many eligible three-acre MHC sites as possible make progress on constructing the stormwater controls needed for Stormwater General Permit 3-9050 compliance. The State is requesting proposals to develop and administer this Initiative. The selected bidder will provide and/or subcontract both 1) Program Delivery and 2) Project Completion services described in further detail in the Scope of Work section of this RFP.

bid_title: ARPA Flood Recovery Resources and Municipal Drinking Water at Risk of Failure
bid_description: To help address flooding impacts, and to assist the support of small primarily residential water and sewer systems using funds provided through American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA), the State of Vermont is providing is providing $6,873,200.00 for eligible entities with small and primarily residential customer bases. These funds will be used to repair, upgrade or replace components of existing systems that are at risk of failure or have failed. The State continues to track the impacts of July 2023 flood on water infrastructure, and subject to need and the availability funding, additional funds may be made available to support this RFP. In accordance with Executive Order No. 02-22, signed on March 3, 2022, by Governor Phil Scott, the State is required to secure your certification that no Russian-sourced goods or services provided or produced by Russian entities will be provided to the State of Vermont under this proposal. In submitting this proposal, you are providing this certification to the State. Vermont’s Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) seeks proposals for a single entity to oversee and administer these ARPA funds. The Awardee will oversee project solicitation and prioritization, as well as manage and administer dollars to support as many water systems as available funding allows. The purpose of this money is to support two “Tiers” of funding to support VT’s smaller, primarily residential communities, where infrastructure is at risk of failure or has failed either due to the storm, or due to age-related deficiencies.

bid_title: Handpulling Water Chestnut North & Other
bid_description: The State of Vermont is seeking proposals for the handpulling of water chestnut plants from seven designated locations in central and southern Lake Champlain (Addison County) and within Vermont on other northern waterbodies (approximately 300+ acres).

bid_title: Storm Water Master Planning
bid_description: The State of Vermont requests formal written proposals and qualifications from consultants to supply Stormwater Master Planning (SWMP) services to the State’s Clean Water Initiative Program.

bid_title: Storm Water Master Planning
bid_description: The State of Vermont requests formal written proposals and qualifications from consultants to supply Stormwater Master Planning (SWMP) services to the State’s Clean Water Initiative Program.

bid_title: Storm Water Master Planning
bid_description: The State of Vermont requests formal written proposals and qualifications from consultants to supply Stormwater Master Planning (SWMP) services to the State’s Clean Water Initiative Program.

bid_title: Clean Water Workforce Capacity Development Block Grant
bid_description: The purpose of the Clean Water Workforce Capacity Development Block Grant is to support and invest in the capacity of the State of Vermont’s clean water partners, including both current partners and potential new partners. The grant should address unmet capacity needs and ensure that a strong partnership network will continue to efficiently deliver high quality and high priority clean water projects.

bid_title: 2025 Enhancement Dam Removal Design and Implementation
bid_description: The Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) Clean Water Initiative Program (CWIP) is requesting proposals to manage a competitive Enhancement Dam Removal Design and Implementation Program. The intent of the program is to support the design and implementation of eligible and priority enhancement dam removal projects.

bid_title: Restorative Justice Organizational Consulting
bid_description: DCF is seeking to enter a contract or contracts with one or more vendors who has/have demonstrated experience in restorative practice and organizational consultation services that will embed practices more deeply into the work of the division, for the betterment of the workforce and the families served. DCF/FSD would like to explore and identify action steps and/or a strategic plan to achieve the desired state.

bid_title: River Valley Therapeutic Residence Psychiatry Services
bid_description: The purpose of the RFP is to solicit proposals from qualified individuals or companies to provide physician psychiatry services for the DMH River Valley Therapeutic Residence.

bid_title: Disaster Mental Health Planning
bid_description: The purpose of the RFP is to solicit proposals from qualified vendors in order to engage stakeholders to compile and develop our Disaster Mental Health Plan. The State of Vermont currently has limited and outdated emergency preparedness and response plans for disaster mental health. The documents no longer match the current landscape of the public mental health system of care, and do not effectively lay the foundation for the State’s capabilities or how it could be better used during various degrees of emergencies and disasters. An updated plan needs to be developed in order to provide internal clarity and point of reference for DMH, the Vermont Agency of Human Services (AHS), its sister departments, as well as a means of informing other state government partners, community organizations, and broader stakeholders that may not be aware of the supports available or existing limitations.

bid_title: Virtual and/or In-Person Forensic Psychiatrist Competency Evaluators
bid_description: The purpose of the RFP is to solicit proposals from qualified individuals or companies [forensic psychiatrists] in order to provide virtual and/or in-person competency evaluations in criminal cases throughout Vermont for the purpose of determining if criminal defendants are competent to stand trial (13 V.S.A. § 4814).

bid_title: Vermont Responsible Gaming and Problem Gambling
bid_description: The purpose of the RFP is to solicit proposals from qualified vendors in order to meet the responsible gaming and problem gambling program objectives of the State.

bid_title: Vermont Suicide Prevention Symposium
bid_description: The purpose of the RFP is to solicit proposals from non-profit organizations for the delivery of an annual, in person Vermont Suicide Prevention Symposium. The organization will organize, develop, deliver, complete, and provide an evaluation. The intent of the symposium is for mental health providers, community members, suicide preventions leaders, and field advocates to learn, engage, and increase knowledge via workshops and plenaries on best practices, innovative strategies, and current research. Components of the symposium should include, various learning tracks, relevant discussion topics, a minimum of one keynote address, and time for networking with colleagues. The space should comply with accessibility requirements.

bid_title: Information, Referral and Assistance Systems Assessment
department: Dept. of Disabilities, Aging & Independent Living
bid_description: The State of Vermont, Department of Disabilities, Aging, and Independent Living (DAIL) is a department within the Vermont Agency of Human Services. The Adult Services Division (ASD) is responsible for a full array of long-term services and supports for older Vermonters and adults with physical disabilities. DAIL/ASD proposes to contract for an assessment of the current AHS IR&A systems for Vermonters seeking help with human services to ensure equitable access to services and high quality IR&A customer experiences. The primary focus is to be on what is working and what is not working in the current systems, in addition to research of successful systems and best practices, resulting in a report of findings and recommendations on improvements that can be made across IR&A systems with as much alignment across systems as possible.

bid_title: Centerbrook Dam Removal and Wetland Restoration - Hyde Park
bid_description: In March of 2023, a small parcel located by the Centerville Brook Dam was sold to the Town of Hyde Park. Spring of 2023 the Town of Hyde Park met with state and regional partners from the Vermont Department of Environmental Conservation, the Vermont Natural Resources Council, and the Lamoille County Planning Commission to evaluate this site for a potential dam removal and wetland restoration project. This project is located in Hyde Park along Centerville Brook, on a 0.25-acre parcel near the intersection of Centerville Road and Brook Road. Summer of 2023 the Town of Hyde Park applied for funding through the Lamoille Basin Clean Water Service Provider to pursue preliminary design engineering for this site. In fall of 2023 the Town of Hyde Park transferred project sponsorship and the awarded grant to the LCPC to manage and provide project coordination support. This scoping study will include a flood analysis and alternatives analysis to explore different options for the site. The existing wetland habitat has been established over the last 90 years with the dam installed in 1932. There is a fair amount of sediment impounded behind the dam. This preliminary design work will help plan for a partial or full dam removal and potential wetland restoration project. These efforts will improve aquatic organism passage and explore maintaining the existing wetland habitat and re-establishing a natural stream channel to enhance flood water capacity and improve water quality. Design plans must consider the existing use of the dry hydrant on site and continued emergency access.

bid_title: Request of Proposals - Final Design Engineering Holmes Meadow Floodplain Restoration Johnson
bid_description: In Partnership with the Lamoille County Planning Commission (LCPC), the Town of Johnson received a Flood Resilient Communities Fund Grant in Spring of 2021 funded by the Vermont Emergency Management to acquire a parcel in Johnson, and design, engineer, and construct an active floodplain restoration project on site. The final design will be informed by the local community vision and goals for the site. This proposed active floodplain restoration project is located at the 2.4-acre, town-owned parcel at the end of River Road West, Johnson, VT. This property, VT Route 15, and the Village of Johnson are highly susceptible to flooding. This river/road conflict area is a key location identified for floodplain restoration in the 2019 Lamoille River Flood Model. The floodplain restoration project will enhance floodplain access by removing a man-made berm, lower the floodplain, and create a riparian forest. The project will allow floodwaters to dissipate naturally into a vegetated area, improve “hydraulic roughness,” and prevent the spread of invasive species. Increasing access to the floodplain will reduce future flooding and erosion along Route 15, in the Village of Johnson, and along the banks of the Lamoille River. This project expands upon previous hydraulic modeling efforts along the Lamoille River. The 2019 Lamoille River Flood Model identified where active floodplain restoration has the potential to reduce flood levels and flood water velocities in the Village of Johnson and on Route 15. Due to the Holmes Meadows’ critical location at a bend in the Lamoille Mainstem near the confluence with the Gihon River, floodplain restoration would reduce potential risks and damages from flooding and ice jamming by providing a location for the river to deposit ice and other debris outside of the river channel. This project will aid in reducing the flow of nutrients and sediment from flood waters to the Lamoille River by improving floodplain function and management, allowing floodwaters to access the floodplain and sediment to drop out onto the field during flooding events. The hydraulic modeling for the proposed active floodplain restoration demonstrates an existing berm blocks flood flows from reaching the floodplain until flood waters are higher than the 50-year flood. In addition to floodplain restoration and berm removal, the final design and engineering work will incorporate a vision for the site identified during community engagement meetings.

bid_title: Vermont Studio Center Floodplain Restoration Project Preliminary Design Engineering
bid_description: In the Fall of 2023, the Vermont Studio Center reached out to LCPC to inquire about using the Wolf Kahn Lodge studio as a floodplain mitigation and educational area. In winter of 2024, LCPC, VSC, and state partners from the Vermont Department of Environmental Conservation, met to evaluate this site for a potential flood mitigation project. This project is located in the center of Johnson Village along the Gihon River, on a 0.5-acre parcel near the Pearl Street Bridge. In Spring of 2024, LCPC applied for funding through the Lamoille Basin Clean Water Service Provider to pursue preliminary design engineering for this site. The grant gave LCPC the means to manage and provide project coordination support. This scoping study will include a flood analysis and alternatives analysis to explore different options for the site. There is a fair amount of fill due to the site being the former site of the Town Garage. This preliminary design work will help plan for a potential floodplain restoration project. These efforts will improve the area to reestablish a natural stream channel to enhance flood water capacity and improve water quality. Design plans must consider the existing uses of adjacent parcels and the possibility of an educational pollinator garden.

bid_title: Architectural and Engineering Services, Municipal Services Complex Creamery Road, Hardwick
bid_description: The Northeastern Vermont Development Association (NVDA), the regional planning and development corporation serving the Northeast Kingdom, is seeking design and engineering assistance on behalf of the Town of Hardwick. The Town is planning a new municipal infrastructure campus on Creamery Road that will co-locate a new Town Garage and Hardwick Fire Department. Hardwick Rescue a private, nonprofit ambulance service that responds to 911 calls in Hardwick, Wolcott, Stannard, Craftsbury, Greensboro, Wheelock, Walden, and Woodbury, also intends to lease space on the same site to build a new facility. The Town of Hardwick has developed conceptual plans for the new Town Garage, which will replace the existing undersized facility. However, the existing conceptual designs for the Town Garage do not account for co-location with the Hardwick Fire Station or Hardwick Rescue. The existing Fire Station, located on Wolcott Street has experienced repetitive flooding. The most recent flooding occurred in July 2023, and the fire trucks had to be moved. Relocation of this critical infrastructure will help to make the community more flood resilient. Hardwick Rescue’s plan for a new facility may include an expanded footprint, and without additional architectural investigation, it is not clear how all three functions can be effectively located on the site. An architectural/engineering firm would therefore be needed to fully vet the co-location concept. The proposed location on Creamery Road also currently contains a WWII-era Quonset garage, which may require an assessment by a licensed architectural historian to determine what mitigation strategies might be required.
